Sentencas: Hydrogen sulfide is known to degrade the solid oxide fuel cell (SOFC) performance by adsorbing on the nickel anode catalyst.
Titulo: Performance degradation of solid oxide fuel cells due to sulfur poisoning of the electrochemical reaction and internal reforming reaction

Sentencas: In this research, the mechanism underlying such SOFC degradation was evaluated based on a theoretical mathematical modeling approach and the sulfur coverage was calculated from a Temkin-like isotherm which is related to both temperature and hydrogen sulfide (H2S) concentration.
Titulo: Performance degradation of solid oxide fuel cells due to sulfur poisoning of the electrochemical reaction and internal reforming reaction

Sentencas: The influences of the cell temperature, H2S concentration and electrochemical performance on both the sulfur coverage and cell polarization are studied in detail.
Titulo: Performance degradation of solid oxide fuel cells due to sulfur poisoning of the electrochemical reaction and internal reforming reaction

Sentencas: Two specific models were considered to identify whether sulfur poisoning has a larger impact on cell performance through its effect on the electrochemical reaction or on the internal reforming reaction.
Titulo: Performance degradation of solid oxide fuel cells due to sulfur poisoning of the electrochemical reaction and internal reforming reaction

Sentencas: It was found that sulfur poisoning has different effects on the hydrogen oxidation reaction and internal reforming reaction, leading to competing changes in cell performance with temperature and H2S concentration.
Titulo: Performance degradation of solid oxide fuel cells due to sulfur poisoning of the electrochemical reaction and internal reforming reaction
